Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.collection

Interface WiredIterator<E>

Type Parameters:
E - The type of the elements being iterated over
All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Iterator<E>
public sealed interface WiredIterator<E> extends Iterator<E>, AutoCloseable
A one-way-only iterator that, in practice, still provides the same functionality as ListIterator. A WiredIterator lets you flip the direction of the iteration through the turn() method. The next() and hasNext() methods are always relative to the direction of the traversal.
See Also:
  • WiredList.wiredIterator(boolean)
  • SynchronizedWiredList.wiredIterator(boolean)

  • Method Details

    • set

      void set(E newVal)
      Sets the value of the element arrived at by the last call to next(). An IllegalStateException is thrown if Iterator.next() has not been called yet.
      Parameters:
      newVal - The new value for the element.

    • peek

      E peek()
      Returns the value that would be returned by a call to Iterator.next() without actually moving towards the next element. A NoSuchElementException is thrown if the iterator has arrived at the last element.
      Returns:
      The value that would be returned by a call to#next().

    • turn

      WiredIterator<E> turn()
      Flips the direction of the iteration. The returned Iterator is initialized to be at the same element as this Iterator. An IllegalStateException is thrown if Iterator.next() has not been called yet.
      Returns:
      A WiredIterator that the traverses the list in the opposite direction.

    • close

      default void close()
      Provides a hook for implementations returned by SynchronizedWiredList to release the Lock acquired at the start of the iteration. You SHOULD ALWAYS use a try-with-resources block to obtain a WiredIterator from a SynchronizedWiredList. This is unnecessary for a regular WiredList.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
